page.title: 05HOSPITAL AND HOMES
page.content: HOSPITAL & HOMES OF ST.GILES - BICKNACRE In 1913 a group of people,eager to help{lepers}who had contracted the disease in the Empire,met an Essex farmer who wanted to sell 27 acres for Â£1500.One of the group,John Burns,visited his friend,Lord Strathcona,who left them the money in his will. The hospital & homes of St.Giles were established,consisting of a group of bungalows set in open countryside,with a chapel and cemetary. Leprosy patients were cared for by the Brothers of Divine Compassion until 1942,when Anglican Nuns took over. They retired in December 1984. Today there are 9 patients-not contagious.The{ {Springboard Housing Association}are turning it into a community for vulnerable and handicapped people.
